Series of Metal–Organic Frameworks Including Novel Architectural Features Based on a Star-like Tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine Ligand

    Series of Metal–Organic Frameworks Including Novel Architectural Features Based on a Star-like Tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine Ligand

    • Ming-Dao Zhang
      • , 
    • Ling Qin
      • , 
    • Hai-Tao Yang
      • , 
    • Yi-Zhi Li
      • , 
    • Zi-Jian Guo
      • , and 
    • He-Gen Zheng*
    View Author Information
    State Key Laboratory of Coordination Chemistry, School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering, Nanjing National Laboratory of Microstructures, Nanjing University, Nanjing 210093, People’s Republic of China
    *Fax: 86-25-83314502. E-mail: zhenghg@nju.edu.cn
    Cite this: Cryst. Growth Des. 2013, 13, 5, 1961–1969
    Publication Date (Web):March 15, 2013

    SUBJECTS:

    Crystal Growth & Design
    Get e-Alerts

    Abstract

    Six new metal–organic frameworks with novel structural features based on a star-like ligand tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine (TPPA), namely, {[Cd(TPPA)(pht)(H2O)](H2O)2}n (1), {[Zn(TPPA)(pht)](H2O)2}n (2), {[Zn(TPPA)(trans-chdc)0.5(NO3)]·(H2O)}n (3), {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)}n (4), {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)4}n (5), and {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)]}n (6) (H2pht = phthalic acid, trans-H2chdc = trans-1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid, H2bdc = benzene-p-dicarboxylic acid), have been synthesized under solvothermal conditions. Compounds 1–3 all exhibit fascinating 2D → 3D frameworks with coexistence of inclined polycatenation and polythreading characters. On the other hand, compounds 4–6 are three supramolecular isomers. Even though the compositions of 4–6 are almost same, they generate different structures. Compound 4 shows a 2D → 3D framework with parallel polycatenation of undulated square layers. Compound 5 reveals 3-fold interpenetrating 3D frameworks with {4.62}{43.67} crs topology. Compound 6 shows a 4-fold interpenetrating 3D metal–organic polyrotaxane framework. In addition, photophysical properties of 1–3 and the TPPA ligand in the solid state have also been studied.

    Synopsis

    Six new metal−organic frameworks (MOFs) were reported based on a semirigid star-like tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine (TPPA) ligand. Compounds 1−3 exhibit three 2D → 3D frameworks with coexistence of polycatenation and polythreading, and compounds 4−6 are supramolecular isomers with novel structural features.

    Introduction

    ARTICLE SECTIONS
    Jump To
    • Abstract
    • Introduction
    • Experimental Section
    • Results and Discussion
    • Conclusions
    • Supporting Information
    • Acknowledgment
    • References
    Functional metal–organic frameworks (MOFs) are currently of great interest because of their aesthetic structures and potential applications in the fields of photochemical areas, gas adsorption and separation, molecular magnetism, heterogeneous catalysis, and nonlinear optics (NLO).(1) As we know, all applications of MOFs are based on their internal microstructures. However, due to the combined influence of organic ligands,(2) metal ions,(3) solvent systems,(4) and counterions,(5) it still remains a challenge to explore effective synthetic strategies to generate MOFs with expected structures and properties. In this paper, we will investigate generation of MOFs from the aspect of composition and entangled types.
    In the aspect of composition, supramolecular isomers including the same composition has gained much attention in the past few years because of their structural diversity(6) and great potential applications.(7) The construction of organic linkers for supramolecular isomers is often affected by several factors such as diversity of coordination modes, flexibility of ligands, and reaction conditions.(8)
    In the classes of entangled types, polythreading and polycatenation are interesting structural features of entangled systems, which are noticeable realms of chemistry for its potential application such as energy transfer, drug delivery, and relationship with biological systems.(9) Therefore, coordination networks possessing polythreading and polycatenation features simultaneously have high theoretical and potential practical value.
    Compared with benzene- and triazine-centered triangular ligands, the N-centered triangular ligands more easily meet the geometric requirements of metal ions.(10g) The coordination polymers based on triphenylamine derivatives have received intense interest due to their fascinating framework topologies and properties. Recently, a triangular N-centered ligand, tris(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)amine (TIPA, Scheme 1), has been investigated intensely in the fields of coordination polymers.(10) Notably, our group has reported an unprecedented 3D cluster polymer based on Mo(W)/Cu/S and TIPA exhibiting strong third-order nonlinear optical properties.(10i)
    Herein, we replace three imidazolyl groups of TIPA with three pyridyl groups; then a new star-like ligand, named tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine (TPPA, Scheme 1), was synthesized (Scheme S1, Supporting Information). Obviously, the flexibility of TPPA is less than that of TIPA because the nitrogen coordination atoms of TPPA are on the axes of benzene–pyridine arms.(10i, 11) Due to its weakened flexibility, TPPA ligand may have different coordination modes when coordinating to metal ions, which may induce diverse structures, such as supramolecular isomers.
    We adopted three dicarboxylate ligands with different rigidity, namely, phthalic acid (H2pht),(12) benzene-p-dicarboxylic acid (H2bdc),(13) and trans-1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid (trans-H2chdc),(14) as coligands to react with the TPPA ligand and different bivalent metal salts (Scheme 1). Six new compounds were obtained under solvothermal conditions, {[Cd(TPPA)(pht)(H2O)](H2O)2}n (1), {[Zn(TPPA)(pht)](H2O)2}n (2), {[Zn(TPPA)(trans-chdc)0.5(NO3)]·(H2O)}n (3), {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)}n (4), {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)4}n (5), and {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)]}n (6).
    As we expected, the self-assembly of TPPA and dicarboxylate ligands is an effective method to generate unique architectures and topologies. With the same composition, we obtained three supramolecular isomers 4–6 including a rare 4-fold interpenetrating 3D metal–organic polyrotaxane framework (4). In the aspect of entangled types, we obtained three fascinating 2D → 3D frameworks 1–3 with coexistence of inclined polycatenation and polythreading characters.
    All compounds were characterized by elemental analysis, IR spectra, X-ray powder diffraction experiments, and X-ray crystallography. The crystal structures and topological analyses of these compounds are investigated and described in detail. Further, the luminescent properties of the TPPA ligand and compounds 1–3 have also been studied.

    Experimental Section

    ARTICLE SECTIONS
    Jump To
    • Abstract
    • Introduction
    • Experimental Section
    • Results and Discussion
    • Conclusions
    • Supporting Information
    • Acknowledgment
    • References

    Materials and Measurements

    Reagents and solvents employed were commercially available. TPPA ligand was synthesized according to our previous report.(11) All of the samples are stored in mother solutions until the study of properties of 1–6. IR absorption spectra of the compounds were recorded in the range of 400–4000 cm–1 on a Nicolet (Impact 410) spectrometer with KBr pellets. C, H, and N analyses were carried out with a Perkin-Elmer 240C elemental analyzer. Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) measurements were performed on a Bruker D8 Advance X-ray diffractometer using Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å), in which the X-ray tube was operated at 40 kV and 40 mA. Luminescent spectra were recorded on a Perkin-Elmer LS55 fluorescence spectrophotometer at room temperature.

    Synthesis of 1

    A mixture of Cd(NO3)2·6H2O (30.1 mg, 0.1 mmol), TPPA (47.6 mg, 0.1 mmol), and phthalic acid (16.6 mg, 0.1 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of DMF/MeCN/H2O (1:2:3). The final mixture was placed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (25 mL) under autogenous pressure and heated at 95 °C for 3 days. Pale yellow crystals of 1 were collected in 69% yield (based on TPPA ligand). Calcd for CdC41H34N4O7: C, 61.01%; H, 4.25%; N, 6.94%. Found: C, 60.96%; H, 4.28%; N, 6.98%. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3346 (s), 1593 (s), 1553 (s), 1517 (s), 1487 (s), 1410 (s), 1325 (s), 1294 (s), 1226 (s), 1188 (m), 1039 (w), 1015 (w), 1005 (w), 850 (m), 820 (s), 809 (s), 751 (s), 707 (m), 655 (w), 569 (w), 527 (m), 507 (m), 446 (w).

    Synthesis of 2

    A mixture of Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (29.7 mg, 0.1 mmol), TPPA (47.6 mg, 0.1 mmol), and phthalic acid (16.6 mg, 0.1 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of DMF/MeCN/H2O (1:2:3). The final mixture was placed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (25 mL) under autogenous pressure and heated at 95 °C for 3 days. Pale yellow crystals of 2 were collected in 62% yield (based on TPPA ligand). Calcd for ZnC41H32N4O6: C, 66.36%; H, 4.35%; N, 7.55%. Found: C, 66.41%; H, 4.31%; N, 7.49%. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3405 (s), 2933 (w), 1614 (m), 1593 (s), 1520 (s), 1489 (s), 1396 (s), 1329 (s), 1291 (s), 1225 (m), 1190 (m), 1071 (m), 1041 (m), 1019 (m), 821 (s), 812 (s), 760 (s), 725 (w), 669 (w), 566 (m), 525 (m), 510 (s), 479 (w).

    Synthesis of 3

    A mixture of Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (29.7 mg, 0.1 mmol), TPPA (47.6 mg, 0.1 mmol), and trans-1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid (17.2 mg, 0.1 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of DMF/MeCN/H2O (1:2:3). The final mixture was placed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (25 mL) under autogenous pressure and heated at 90 °C for 3 days. Pale yellow crystals of 3 were collected in 55% yield (based on TPPA ligand). Calcd for ZnC37H31N5O6: C, 62.85%; H, 4.42%; N, 9.91%. Found: C, 62.82%; H, 4.43%; N, 9.86%. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3411 (s), 2926 (w), 1667 (m), 1603 (s), 1487 (s), 1412 (m), 1323(m), 1226(m), 1007 (w), 910 (w), 818 (m), 752 (m), 522 (m).

    Synthesis of 4

    A mixture of Co(NO3)2·6H2O (29.1 mg, 0.1 mmol), TPPA (47.6 mg, 0.1 mmol), and benzene-p-dicarboxylic acid (16.6 mg, 0.1 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of DMF/H2O (1:1). The final mixture was placed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (25 mL) under autogenous pressure and heated at 90 °C for 3 days. Red crystals of 4 were collected in 17% yield (based on TPPA ligand). Calcd for CoC41H32N4O6: C, 66.94%; H, 4.38%; N, 7.62%. Found: C, 66.90%; H, 4.36%; N, 7.61%. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3384 (s), 1595 (s), 1578 (s), 1520 (m), 1488 (s), 1430 (w), 1385 (s), 1325 (s), 1292 (m), 1271 (m), 1228 (w), 1185 (w), 1069 (w), 1042 (w), 1018 (w), 816 (s), 747 (s), 564 (w), 519 (m).

    Synthesis of 5

    A mixture of Co(NO3)2·6H2O (29.1 mg, 0.1 mmol), TPPA (47.6 mg, 0.1 mmol), and benzene-p-dicarboxylic acid (33.2 mg, 0.2 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of DMF/MeCN/H2O (1:2:3). The final mixture was placed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (25 mL) under autogenous pressure and heated at 85 °C for 3 days. Orange crystals of 5 were collected in 56% yield (based on TPPA ligand). Calcd for CoC41H38N4O9: C, 62.36%; H, 4.85%; N, 7.09%. Found: C, 62.40%; H, 4.86%; N, 7.11%. IR (KBr, cm–1): 3416 (s), 1597 (s), 1519 (m), 1490 (s), 1382 (s), 1323 (m), 1292 (m), 1270 (m), 1226 (w), 1188 (w), 1071 (w), 1039 (w), 1007 (w), 853 (w), 814 (s), 798 (m), 752 (s), 564 (w), 519 (m).

    Synthesis of 6

    A mixture of Co(NO3)2·6H2O (29.1 mg, 0.1 mmol), TPPA (47.6 mg, 0.1 mmol), and benzene-p-dicarboxylic acid (33.2 mg, 0.2 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of DMA/H2O (1:1). The final mixture was placed in a Parr Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (25 mL) under autogenous pressure and heated at 100 °C for 3 days. Red crystals of 6 were collected in 60% yield (based on TPPA ligand). Calcd for CoC41H28N4O4: C, 70.39%; H, 4.03%; N, 8.01%. Found: C, 70.43%; H, 4.05%; N, 7.99%. IR (KBr, cm–1): 1595 (s), 1519 (m), 1489 (s), 1408 (m), 1330 (m), 1292 (m), 1270 (m), 1223 (w), 1188 (m), 1037 (w), 1012 (w), 838 (w), 818 (s), 749 (s), 752 (s), 567 (w), 517 (m).

    X-ray Crystallography

    X-ray crystallographic data for 1, 2, and 3 were collected at room temperature using epoxy-coated crystals mounted on glass fiber. X-ray crystallographic data for 4, 5, and 6 were collected at room temperature by way of sealing the better single crystals in a quartz tube with mother liquor. X-ray crystallographic data of these compounds were collected on a Bruker Apex Smart CCD diffractometer with graphite-monochromated Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å). Structure solutions were solved by direct methods, and the non-hydrogen atoms were located from the trial structures and then refined anisotropically with SHELXTL using full-matrix least-squares procedures based on F2 values.(15) The hydrogen atom positions were fixed geometrically at calculated distances and allowed to ride on the parent atoms. The relevant crystallographic data are presented in Table 1, while the selected bond lengths and angles are given in the Supporting Information (Table S1). A semiempirical absorption correction was applied using SADABS.(16) The topological analysis and some diagrams were produced using the TOPOS program.(17)
    Table 1. Crystallographic Data and Structure Refinement Details for Compounds 1–6

    Results and Discussion

    ARTICLE SECTIONS
    Jump To
    • Abstract
    • Introduction
    • Experimental Section
    • Results and Discussion
    • Conclusions
    • Supporting Information
    • Acknowledgment
    • References

    Crystal Structure of {[Cd(TPPA)(pht)(H2O)](H2O)2}n (1)

    The crystal structure determination reveals that complex 1 crystallizes in orthorhombic crystal system of Pbcn. The local coordination geometry around the Cd2+ atom is depicted in Figure 1. The Cd1 atom coordinates to two N atoms from different TPPA ligands, one oxygen atom from the coordinated water molecule, and four oxygen atoms from two distinct deprotonated phthalic acids. The Cd–O lengths are in the range of 2.212(3)–2.587(3) Å and Cd–N lengths are 2.238(4)–2.253(4) Å, which are all similar to the values found in other Cd(II) complexes.(18) As shown in Figure 2a, there are two deprotonated phthalic acid coordinated by two neighboring Cd(II) cations on the symmetrical position, forming a 14-membered ring.
    Each 14-membered ring was connected with four pyridine groups from four TPPA ligands to form an undulating 2D network (Figure 2b). For each TPPA ligand, two nitrogen atoms (N1 and N2) from two pyridine groups were coordinated by two Cd atoms, while the remaining nitrogen atom (N3) from the remaining pyridine group did not coordinate with any atoms. One fascinating structural feature of complex 1 is that the phenyl–pyridyl arms with free nitrogen atoms on the two sides of one 2D layer network thread into two adjacent parallel 2D layer networks (Figure 2c), confirming that complex 1 possesses polythreading character.
    Better insight into these 2D layer frameworks can be accessed by the topological method. Each [Cd2(pht)2(H2O)2] unit (Figure 2a), including the 14-membered ring, can be simplified as 4-connecting nodes, and the TPPA ligand in bidentate mode can be considered as a linker. Then, the 2D layer frameworks in complex 1 can be simplified to a (4,4) rhombic grid coordination polymer layer with sql topology (Figure 2d). Packing of the layers generates two sets of layers oriented toward different directions. Each of the two adjacent layers are catenated by two other adjacent windows from another layer in the other set. That is, these two sets of layers catenate to each other in a parallel–parallel arrangement to form a 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation structure.

    Crystal Structure of {[Zn(TPPA)(pht)](H2O)2}n (2)

    There is an obvious difference of the coordination modes of metal atoms in 1 and 2 (Figure 1 and Figure 3a). Each Zn atom in 2 coordinates to two N atoms from different TPPA ligands and four oxygen atoms from two distinct deprotonated phthalic acids. No water molecules coordinated to the Zn atom in 2. Nevertheless, complexes 1 and 2 are isostructural from the topological viewpoint. There are also 14-membered rings consisting of deprotonated phthalic acid coordinated by two neighboring Zn atoms in 2, as shown in Figure 3b. Each [Zn2(pht)2] unit in 2 also connects to four N atoms from different TPPA ligands (Figure 3b). Because the other structure features are very similar to those of complex 1, we do not describe them any further. Single 2D net, 2D layers accumulated toward a single direction, and schematic view of the sql topology of 3 are depicted in Figures S1–S3 of Supporting Information.

    Crystal Structure of {[Zn(TPPA)(trans-chdc)0.5(NO3)]·(H2O)}n (3)

    The crystal structure determination reveals that complex 3 crystallizes in the orthorhombic crystal system of Pbca. The local coordination geometry around the Zn atom is depicted in Figure 4. The Zn1 atom coordinates to two oxygen atoms from one trans-chdc2– anion, two oxygen atoms from one nitrate anion, and two N atoms from two different TPPA ligands; thus, the Zn2+ atoms can be considered as 3-connecting nodes.
    Each TPPA ligand links two Zn atoms, acting as a linker to form a 1D wavelike chain (Figure 5a). Adjacent chains are linked by trans-chdc2– anions to form a single 2D network (Figure 5a,b). Just like 1 and 2, two nitrogen atoms (N1 and N3) from two pyridine groups were coordinated by two Cd atoms, while the remaining nitrogen atom (N2) from the remaining pyridine group did not coordinate with any atoms for each TPPA ligand. The phenyl–pyridyl arms with free nitrogen atoms on the two sides of one 2D layer network also thread into two adjacent parallel 2D layer networks (Figure 5c), confirming that compound 3 shows polythreading character. Therefore, the crystal structures of 1–3 all exhibit polythreading character.
    Both of the TPPA ligand and trans-chdc2– anions can be simplified as linkers. The 2D layer frameworks in compound 3 can be simplified to a Shubnikov hexagonal plane net with hcb topology (Figure 5d). Packing of the layers generates two sets of layers oriented in different directions. Each of the two adjacent layers in 3 are catenated by two other adjacent windows from another layer in the other set. That is, these two sets of layers catenate to each other in a parallel–parallel arrangement to form a 2D → 3D inclined polycatenation structure. We confirm that compounds 1–3 all show polycatenation features. To the best of our knowledge, crystal structures with coexisting polythreading and polycatenation features are highly rare till now.(9)

    Crystal Structure of {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)}n (4)

    Complex 4 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/n. The local coordination geometry around the Co2+ atom is depicted in Figure 6. The Co1 atom coordinates to two N atoms from different TPPA ligands, one oxygen atom from the coordinated water molecule, and three oxygen atoms from two distinct deprotonated phthalic acids; thus, the Co2+ atoms can be considered as 4-connecting nodes.
    The coordination modes of the two carboxylate groups from the bdc2– anion are different in 4: monodentate (O3) and chelate (O1, O2). Adjacent Co atoms are linked by bdc2– anions to generate Co–carboxylate chains. The chains are further extended by TPPA ligands in bidentate modes, resulting in a simple puckered sql (square layer) network (Figure 7a,b).
    There is a large window in the puckered sheet with dimensions of 19.2 × 10.6 Å (Figure 7a,b). Within the sheet, the Co atoms are not all coplanar; rather, half fall in one plane and half in the other parallel plane. The puckered nature of the sheets with large square windows may offer a good chance to form a polycatenated network. Indeed, in 4, each layer is entangled directly by two adjacent sql layers left and right, as shown in Figure 7c. The mode of polycatenation is shown in Figure 7d, where the TPPA linkers of one layer pass through the cavity of the others. As far as we know, only a few examples of dimensionality increasing from 2D layers to overall 3D entanglements have been observed for parallel polycatenation systems so far.(10f, 19)

    Crystal Structure of {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)4}n (5)

    The crystal structure determination reveals that complex 5 crystallizes in monoclinic crystal system of P21/n. The local coordination geometry around the Co2+ atom can be described as a {CoN3O3} distorted octahedron, with the axial positions occupied by one oxygen atom from one coordinated water molecule and one N donor atom from one TPPA ligand (Figure 8). The equatorial plane consists of two N donor atoms from another two TPPA ligands and two oxygen atoms from two bdc2– ligands. TPPA ligands are coordinated to the Co2+ atom to form a 2D hexagonal grid with planar layers (Figure 9a). Such layers are further connected by bdc2– ligands (Figure 9b), leading to the formation of a 3D framework.
    The Co2+ atom can be regarded as a five-connected node, the TPPA ligand can be considered as a three-connected node (distances of N4 and Co, 10.654–10.683 Å), and each bdc2– ligand can be considered as a linear linker (distances of corresponding Co–Co, 11.352 and 11.538 Å), thus forming a (3,5)-connected network (Figure 9d). There is also a channel with a cross section of approximately 11 × 24 Å in the single network (Figure 9c). The channel is so large that the two other 3D frameworks can be accommodated in this channel (Figure 9e,f). According to a calculation performed using PLATON, complex 5 contains a solvent-accessible void space of 27.0% of the total crystal volume. The Schläfli symbol for this binodal net is {4.62}{43.67}, and the topology type of this net is crs (Figure 9e).

    Crystal Structure of {[Co(TPPA)(bdc)]}n (6)

    The crystal structure determination reveals that compound 6 crystallizes in triclinic crystal system of P1̅. The local coordination geometry around the Co2+ atom is depicted in Figure 10. The Co1 atom coordinates to three oxygen atoms from two distinct bdc2– anions and three N atoms from three different TPPA ligands; thus, the Co2+ atoms can be considered as 5-connecting nodes. Each TPPA ligand links three Co atoms, acting as a 3-connecting node to form a 1D ladder-like chain (Figure 11a).
    In structure 6, two adjacent parallel chains are joined by two bdc2– ligands. Meanwhile, both bdc2– ligands are joined by one Co2+ atom. Another 1D ladder-like chain is joined with the same Co2+ atom. Finally, a single 3D framework is created by repeating these linkages (Figure 11b). Rectangular channels exist (Figure 11c) with a cross section of approximately 20 × 20 Å (excluding van der Waals radii) in the single 3D framework. So the channel is large enough to accommodate three other equivalent ones (Figure 11d), giving rise to a 4-fold interpenetrating framework. Upon interpenetration, compound 6 contains a small solvent-accessible void space of 4.5% of the total crystal volume calculated by PLATON. The Schläfli symbol for this binodal net is {42.65.83}{42.6}, and the topology type of this net is 3,5T1 (Figure 11e).
    The ladder-like chain in 6 (Figure 11a) can be considered as a successions of loops, and deprotonated bdc2– acids can be considered as rods threading the loops, indicating that compound 6 possesses the rare, fascinating polyrotaxane character. To the best of our knowledge, only a few interpenetrating 3D metal–organic polyrotaxane frameworks have been reported.(10b, 11)

    Supramolecular Isomeric Nature of compounds 4–6

    Supramolecular isomerism refers to two or more supramolecular systems that have the same composition and building blocks but generate different architectures.(6) As we can see, different supramolecular structures 4–6 are all mainly constructed from Co atoms, deprotonated benzene-p-dicarboxylic acid anions, and TPPA molecules. Moreover, the ratios of the three compositions are all the same (1:1:1). Therefore, we should consider compounds 4–6 as supramolecular isomers, despite of the existence of different coordinated or free water molecules. Although one-pot synthesis of two or more coordinated polymers has been reported, one-pot synthesis of two supramolecular isomers is rare,(21) and such synthesis of three supramolecular isomers is much less.

    Photophysical Properties

    Luminescent compounds are of great interest due to their various appliatoms in chemical sensors, photochemistry, and light-emitting diodes (LEDs).(1a, 20) Compounds 1–3 are insoluble in common organic solvents; hence photoluminescence properties of 1–3 and free TPPA ligand were investigated in the solid state at room temperature (Figure 12 and Table 2).
    As shown in Figure 12, the free TPPA ligand exhibits an intense emission between 480 and 600 nm (λmax = 525 nm upon excitation at 420 nm), which originated from charge transfer of the internal TPPA ligand. Two emission peaks can be observed for both of 1 and 2. The peaks in the range of 440–490 nm for 1 and 2 can be ascribed to the π*−π transitions between deprotonated phthalic acid and TPPA ligand upon metal coordination to different degrees. The peaks in the range of 490–600 nm for 1 and 2 should be attributed to the charge transfer of the internal TPPA ligand. In comparison to free TPPA ligands, the slightly blue shift of emission of 2 can be ascribed to the weak π*−π transitions of the TPPA ligands upon metal coordination. Because luminescent emission of trans-1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid is negligible,(14) there is almost no π*−π transitions between deprotonated trans-1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid and TPPA ligand, and we did not observe an obvious peak in the range of 440–490 nm. The single emission peak in the range of 490–600 nm for compound 3 can be attributed to the charge transfer of the internal TPPA ligand. In comparison to free TPPA ligands, the red shift of emission of 3 can be ascribed to the ligand-to-metal charge-transfer (LMCT) transitions.(22)
    Table 2. Detailed Parameters Extracted from Photoluminescent Properties of 1–3 and Free TPPA Ligand
    compdλex, nmλem, nm [lifetime,a ns (rel)]
    1422460 [0.92 (79.96%), 4.12 (20.04%)], 527 [2.84 (65.67%), 12.31 (34.33%)]
    2430470 [1.55 (50.95%), 4.40 (49.05%)], 510 [2.13 (55.81%), 6.19 (44.19%)]
    3432552 [2.95 (57.08%), 12.77 (42.92%)]
    TPPA420525 [3.53 (55.70%), 17.84 (44.30%)]
    a

    The luminescent decay curves were fitted with a double-exponential decay function: fit = A + B1 exp(−t/τ1) + B2 exp(−t/τ2).

    Furthermore, the emission decay lifetimes of 1–3 and free TPPA ligand were monitored. The luminescent decay curves (Figures S9–S14, Supporting Information) can be fitted with a double-exponential decay function. The results are summarized in Table 2. Emission lifetime values (τ1 and τ2) are both higher than the corresponding values of 1–3, indicating that the emission of 1–3 can be mostly attributed to the charge transfer of the internal TPPA ligand.(23) For compound 1, the emission lifetime values for emission at 527 nm are higher than the values for emission at 460 nm, indicating that emission of charge transfer of the internal TPPA ligand is longer than emission of π*−π transitions between the carboxylate ligand and TPPA ligand, as well as compound 2.

    PXRD Results

    To confirm whether the crystal structures are truly representative of the bulk materials tested in photochemical studies, PXRD experiments were carried out for compounds 1–3. The PXRD experimental and computer-simulated patterns of the compounds 1–3 are shown in the Supporting Information, Figures S4–S6, and they show that the bulk synthesized materials and the measured single crystals for 1–3 are the same.

    Conclusions

    ARTICLE SECTIONS
    Jump To
    • Abstract
    • Introduction
    • Experimental Section
    • Results and Discussion
    • Conclusions
    • Supporting Information
    • Acknowledgment
    • References
    In summary, as we expected, the self-assembly of TPPA and carboxylate ligands is an effective method to generate aesthetic architectures and topologies. In this work, six new metal–organic frameworks have been successfully synthesized by the self-assembly of TPPA ligand, carboxylate ligands (H2pht, H2bdc, or trans-H2chdc), and various metal ions under solvothermal conditions. Compounds 1–4 reveal fascinating 2D → 3D structures. Compounds 1–3 exhibit coexisting inclined polycatenation and polythreading characters. Compounds 4–6 are three supramolecular isomers. Even though the compositions of 4–6 are the same, they generate different structures. Compound 4 shows a 2D → 3D framework with parallel polycatenation of undulated square layers (sql). Compound 5 reveals 3-fold interpenetrating 3D frameworks with {4.62}{43.67} crs topology. Compound 6 shows a 4-fold interpenetrating 3D metal–organic polyrotaxane framework. Further study about this star-like tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine ligand is in progress.

      1b
      Hydrogen storage in metal-organic frameworks
      Murray, Leslie J.; Dinca, Mircea; Long, Jeffrey R.
      Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1294-1314CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A review of current status of hydrogen storage within metal-org. frameworks. Microporous metal-org. frameworks, having exceptionally high surface areas and chem.-tunable structures, have recently emerged as some of the most promising candidate materials. Particular emphasis is given to the relationships between structural features and the enthalpy of hydrogen adsorption, spectroscopic methods for probing framework-H2 interactions, and strategies for improving storage capacity.

      1c
      Diverse Structures and Magnetism of Cobalt(II) and Manganese(II) Compounds with Mixed Azido and Carboxylato Bridges Induced by Methylpyridinium Carboxylates
      Jia, Qin-Xiang; Tian, Hua; Zhang, Jian-Yong; Gao, En-Qing
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2011), 17 (3), 1040-1051, S1040/1-S1040/5CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Herein the authors present a systematic study of the structures and magnetic properties of six coordination compds. with mixed azide and zwitterionic carboxylate ligands, [M(N3)2(2-mpc)] (2-mpc = N-methylpyridinium-2-carboxylate; M = Co for 1 and Mn for 2), [M(N3)2(4-mpc)] (4-mpc = N-methylpyridinium-4-carboxylate; M = Co for 3 and Mn for 4), [Co3(N3)6(3-mpc)2(MeOH)2] (5), and [Mn3(N3)6(3-mpc)2] (6; 3-mpc = N-methylpyridinium-3-carboxylate). Compds. 1-3 consist of 1-dimensional uniform chains with (μ-EO-N3)2(μ-COO) triple bridges (EO = end-on); 5 is also a chain compd. but with alternating [(μ-EO-N3)2(μ-COO)] triple and [(EO-N3)2] double bridges; Compd. 4 contains two-dimensional layers with alternating [(μ-EO-N3)2(μ-COO)] triple, [(μ-EO-N3)(μ-COO)] double, and (EE-N3) single bridges (EE=end-to-end); 6 is a layer compd. in which chains similar to those in 5 are cross-linked by a μ3-1,1,3-N3 azido group. Magnetically, the three CoII compds. (1, 3, and 5) all exhibit intrachain ferromagnetic interactions but show distinct bulk properties: 1 displays relaxation dynamics at very low temp., 3 is an antiferromagnet with field-induced metamagnetism due to weak antiferromagnetic interchain interactions, and 5 behaves as a noninnocent single-chain magnet influenced by weak antiferromagnetic interchain interactions. The magnetic differences can be related to the interchain interactions through π-π stacking influenced by different substitution positions in the ligands and/or different magnitudes of intrachain coupling. All of the MnII compds. show overall intrachain/intralayer antiferromagnetic interactions. Compd. 2 shows the usual 1-dimensional antiferromagnetism, whereas 4 and 6 exhibit different weak ferromagnetism due to spin canting <13.8 and 4.6 K, resp.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXmtFCjtQ%253D%253D&md5=110ef091b83e9d7b6b767869be1cd600
      (d) Liu, Y.; Xuan, W.; Cui, Y. Adv. Mater. 2010, 22, 4112
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      1d
      Engineering homochiral metal-organic frameworks for heterogeneous asymmetric catalysis and enantioselective separation
      Liu, Yan; Xuan, Weimin; Cui, Yong
      Advanced Materials (Weinheim, Germany) (2010), 22 (37), 4112-4135CODEN: ADVMEW; ISSN:0935-9648. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      A review. Owing to the potential applications in technol. areas such as gas storage, catalysis, sepn., sensing and nonlinear optics, tremendous efforts were devoted to the development of porous metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) over the past ten years. Homochiral porous MOFs are particularly attractive candidates as heterogeneous asym. catalysts and enantioselective adsorbents and separators for prodn. of optically active org. compds. due to the lack of homochiral inorg. porous materials such as zeolites. In this review, the authors summarize the recent research progress in homochiral MOF materials, including their synthetic strategy, distinctive structural features and latest advances in asym. heterogeneous catalysis and enantioselective sepn.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (e) Hou, H. W.; Meng, X. R.; Song, Y. L.; Fan, Y. T.; Zhu, Y.; Lu, H. J.; Du, C. X.; Shao, W. H. Inorg. Chem. 2002, 41, 4068
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      1e
      Two-Dimensional Rhombohedral Grid Coordination Polymers [M(bbbt)2(NCS)2]n (M = Co, Mn, or Cd; bbbt = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis-1H-benzotriazole): Synthesis, Crystal Structures, and Third-Order Nonlinear Optical Properties
      Hou, Hongwei; Meng, Xiangru; Song, Yinglin; Fan, Yaoting; Zhu, Yu; Lu, Huijie; Du, Chenxia; Shao, Weihua
      Inorganic Chemistry (2002), 41 (15), 4068-4075CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Treatment of 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis-1H-benzotriazole (bbbt) and KSCN with Co(II), Mn(II), or Cd(II) afforded three two-dimensional rhombohedral grid coordination polymers [M(bbbt)2(NCS)2]n (M = Co, 1; Mn, 2; Cd, 3). The two-dimensional rhombohedral grids are parallel to the crystallog. ac plane. The rhombohedral grid consists of 44-membered rings of M4(bbbt)4, and gives the dimensions of 12.913 × 10.764 Å for polymer 1, 13.106 × 10.797 Å for polymer 2, and 13.256 × 10.870 Å for polymer 3. The three polymers' third-order nonlinear optical (NLO) properties were detd. by Z-scan technique in DMF soln. The results show that all three polymers show very large NLO absorption and strong NLO refraction properties. The third-order NLO absorptive coeffs. α2 are 5.4 × 10-9 m W-1 for polymer 1, 5.2 × 10-9 m W-1 for polymer 2, and 5.0 × 10-9 m W-1 for polymer 3. The α2 values are larger than those of all the reported cluster compds. The NLO refractive index values n2 of polymers 1-3 are 5.73 × 10-19, 3.55 × 10-19, and 3.07 × 10-19 m2 W-1, resp. Their hyperpolarizability γ values are 2.40 × 10-30 esu for polymer 1, 1.52 × 10-30 esu for polymer 2, and 1.50 × 10-30 esu for polymer 3. The γ values are comparable to those of clusters and better than those of organometallic compds., semiconductors, and fullerene.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38XkvVGnu7g%253D&md5=6d3f8fcecf9efb5d8787896546030c3c

      2a
      Rational design of homochiral solids based on two-dimensional metal carboxylates
      Cui, Yong; Evans, Owen R.; Ngo, Helen L.; White, Peter S.; Lin, Wenbin
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2002), 41 (7), 1159-1162CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
      A chiral two-dimensional network is the basis for the structure of a homochiral solid exploiting metal-carboxylate coordination. The synthesis involved enantiopure bridging ligands and metal-org. secondary building units, and resulted in ethoxy-protected BINOL functionalities pointing into the cavities in this cryst. chiral zeolitic material. The cobalt, manganese and nickel-derived complexes of (1S)-6,6'-dichloro-2,2'-diethoxy-1,1'-binaphthalene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid were reported. The cobalt-derived complex of (1R)-6,6'-dichloro-2,2'-diethoxy-1,1'-binaphthalene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid was also reported; using either the (1S)-isomer or the (1R)-isomer, supramol. enantiomers were obtained.

      2b
      Reticular synthesis and the design of new materials
      Yaghi, Omar M.; O'Keeffe, Michael; Ockwig, Nathan W.; Chae, Hee K.; Eddaoudi, Mohamed; Kim, Jaheon
      Nature (London, United Kingdom) (2003), 423 (6941), 705-714CODEN: NATUAS; ISSN:0028-0836. (Nature Publishing Group)
      A review. The long-standing challenge of designing and constructing new cryst. solid-state materials from mol. building blocks is just beginning to be addressed with success. A conceptual approach that requires the use of secondary building units to direct the assembly of ordered frameworks epitomizes this process: the authors call this approach reticular synthesis. This chem. has yielded materials designed to have predetd. structures, compns. and properties. In particular, highly porous frameworks held together by strong metal-O-C bonds and with exceptionally large surface area and capacity for gas storage were prepd. and their pore metrics systematically varied and functionalized.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      2c
      Silver(I) Complexes of Fixed, Polytopic Bis(pyrazolyl)methane Ligands: Influence of Ligand Geometry on the Formation of Discrete Metallacycles and Coordination Polymers
      Reger, Daniel L.; Watson, Russell P.; Smith, Mark D.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (25), 10077-10087CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Reactions of the arene-linked bis(pyrazolyl)methane ligands m-bis[bis(1-pyrazolyl)methyl]benzene, (m-[CH(pz)2]2C6H4, Lm), p-bis[bis(1-pyrazolyl)methyl]benzene, (p-[CH(pz)2]2C6H4, Lp), and 1,3,5-tris[bis(1-pyrazolyl)methyl]benzene (1,3,5-[CH(pz)2]3C6H3, L3) with AgX salts (pz = 1-pyrazolyl; X = BF4- or PF6-) yield two types of mol. motifs depending on the arrangement of the ligating sites about the central arene ring. Reactions of the m-phenylene-linked Lm with AgBF4 and AgPF6 afford complexes consisting of discrete, metallacyclic dications:[Ag2(μ-Lm)2](BF4)2 (1) and [Ag2(μ-Lm)2](PF6)2 (2). When the p-phenylene-linked Lp is treated with AgBF4 and AgPF6, acyclic, cationic coordination polymers were obtained:{[Ag(μ-Lp)]BF4}∞ (3) and {[Ag(μ-Lp)]PF6}∞ (4). Reaction of the ligand L3, contg. three bis(pyrazolyl)methane units in a meta arrangement, with an equimolar amt. of AgBF4 again yields discrete metallacyclic dications in which one bis(pyrazolyl)methane unit on each ligand remains unbound: [Ag2(μ-L3)2](BF4)2 (5). Treatment of L3 with an excess of AgBF4 affords a polymer of metallacycles, {[Ag3(μ-L3)2](BF4)3}∞ (6), with one of the bis(pyrazolyl)methane units on each ligand bound to a silver cation bridging two metallacycles. The supramol. structures of the silver(I) complexes 1-6 are organized by noncovalent interactions, including weak hydrogen bonding, π-π, and anion-π interactions.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XhtVyhtrzO&md5=09726720ecd4fe10fdd9fd1946ceb844
      (d) Luo, F.; Che, Y. X.; Zheng, J. M. Cryst. Growth Des. 2009, 9, 1066
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      2d
      Trinuclear Cobalt Based Porous Coordination Polymers Showing Unique Topological and Magnetic Variety upon Different Dicarboxylate-like Ligands
      Luo, Feng; Che, Yun-xia; Zheng, Ji-min
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (2), 1066-1071CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      One-pot solvothermal self-assembly is employed to prep. Co3 based porous coordination polymers, viz. (1), [H2NMe2]2[Co3(i.p.)4]·H2O; (2), [H2NMe2]2[Co3(bdc)4]·(DMF)2; (3), [H2NMe2]2[Co3(bpdc)4]·(CH3OH)2(DMF)1.5, where i.p., bdc, bpdc, and DMF are 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, 4,4'-biphenyldicarboxylate, and N,N'-DMF, resp. Via different org. connectors such as i.p., bdc, and bpdc, such Co3 mol. building blocks (MBB), [Co3(CO2)8]2-, are assocd. together to give a tunable 8-connected topol. framework, viz. 42464 for 1, 36414576 for 2, and 36418536 for 3. Upon the geometry and the length of org. connectors, their corresponding porosity occupied by c counterions plus solvent mols. also can be tunable, for example, with the consideration of [H2NMe2]+ counterions, the solvent-accessible vol. is 460.2 Å3 for 1, equal to 23.9% of the cell vol., 3320.4 Å3 for 2, equal to 56.3% of the cell vol., 4107.2 Å3 for 3, equal to 50% of the cell vol. Notably, besides these outstanding features of tunable 8-connected topol. and porosity, their magnetic properties such as ferromagnetic behavior without magnetic ordering for 1, spin-canting and metamagnetic behavior with magnetic ordering for 2, as well as spin-canting, metamagnetic, and spin-glass behavior with magnetic ordering for 3 also can be tunable.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhsVGnsLrM&md5=c3077f5101e9d684b77ac34721e589f3
      (e) Qin, L.; Hu, J. S.; Li, Y. Z.; Zheng, H. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 403
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      2e
      Effect of Carboxylate Coligands with Different Rigidity on Supramolecular Architectures Based on One Rigid Didentate Linear Ligand
      Qin, Ling; Hu, Jin-Song; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (1), 403-413CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Six new metal-org. frameworks, namely, {[Cd(bpbenz)(pim)] }n (1), {[Cd(bpbenz)(sea)]·(H2O)2}n (2), {[Cd(bpbenz)(hfipbb)]·(H2O)3}n (3), {[Co(bpbenz)(4,4'-sdb)]·(H2O)2.75}n (4), {[Ni(bpbenz)(4,4'-sdb) (H2O)3]·(H2O)2}n (5), and {[Co(bpbenz)(Hbtc)]·(H2O) }n (6), [bpbenz = 1,4-bis(4-pyridyl)benzene, pim = pimelic acid, sea = sebacic acid, H2hfipbb = 4,4'-(hexafluoroisopropylidene)bis(benzoic acid), 4,4'-H2sdb = 4,4'-sulfonyldibenzoic acid, H3btc = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid], have been synthesized under solvothermal conditions (DMF/H2O; DMF = N,N-dimethylacetamide). These compds. were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectroscopy, and x-ray single-crystal diffraction. Compd. 1 is a 3D network composed of layers of pentagonal-bipyramidal coordinated Cd atoms bridged by pimelic anions in syn-anti configurations and bpbenz mols. between layers with {412.63} pcu topol. In compd. 2, the bpbenz and sebacic anions act as bidentate ligands assembling with Cd(NO3)2 to a 2D framework. Compd. 3 is a 2D network composed of chains, which is bridged by the [Cd2(CO2)4]2L2 SBUs and hfipbb2- anions, and with bpbenz mols. between chains. For compd. 4, the bpbenz and 4,4'-sdb coordinate to Co cations to form a three-dimensional {65.8} cds uninodal network. Compd. 5 features 2D structure with inclined polycatenation (1D + 1D → 2D). For compd. 6, a 2D network with side arms gives a polythreaded network, which exhibits a 2-fold interpenetrating 3D array if H-bonds are taken into account. Magnetic susceptibility measurements indicate that compds. 4 and 6 have dominating antiferromagnetic couplings between metal ions. Furthermore, thermal stabilities for 1-6 and luminescent properties for 1-3 are also discussed.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXhsFSjsbbF&md5=6cff4364528f221946605967b5f7a5a2

      3a
      Syntheses and Characterizations of Three-Dimensional Channel-like Polymeric Lanthanide Complexes Constructed by 1,2,4,5-Benzenetetracarboxylic Acid
      Cao, Rong; Sun, Daofeng; Liang, Yucang; Hong, Maochun; Tatsumi, Kazuyuki; Shi, Qian
      Inorganic Chemistry (2002), 41 (8), 2087-2094CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The hydrothermal reaction of YbCl3·6H2O with 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic dianhydride resulted in [{Yb(bbtec)1/4(dbtec)3/6(H2O)2}4·6H2O]n (1, H4btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid), and the solvothermal reaction of Er(NO3)3·6H2O or TbCl3·6H2O with 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic dianhydride in H2O/acetic acid gave rise to [{Er2(cbtec)2/4(ebtec)2/4(fbtec)2/4(H2O)4}·4H2O]n (2) and [{Tb(H2btec)2/4(fbtec)3/6(H2O)}·2H2O]n (3), resp. Complex 1 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2/m with a 20.8119(5), b 17.6174(1), c 5.7252(2) Å, β 92.324(1)°, and Z = 1. 1 Possesses a three-dimensional framework consisting of eight-coordinate ytterbium centers and two kinds of channels along the c axis. Complex 2 crystallizes in the triclinic space group P‾1 with a 9.6739(5), b 11.0039(5), c 11.5523 Å, α 104.8330(10), β 91.0000(10), γ 114.2570(10)°, and Z = 2. 2 Has a three-dimensional framework structure comprising both eight- and nine-coordinate erbium centers and channels along the a axis. Complex 3 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/n with a 10.7246(12), b 7.1693(9), c 17.158(2) Å, β 97.109(2)°, and Z = 4. 3 Shows a three-dimensional framework contg. nine-coordinate terbium centers and channels along the b axis. Uncoordinated water mols. occupy the channels in the three complexes. TGA and XRPD were detd. for the three complexes, and the framework of 1 is retained upon removal of uncoordinated and coordinated water mols.

      3b
      Supramolecular Behavior of an Isomorphous Series of Five Bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) Complexes
      MacDonald, John C.; Luo, Tzy-Jiun M.; Palmore, G. Tayhas R.
      Crystal Growth & Design (2004), 4 (6), 1203-1209CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      The supramol. chem. and crystal structures of five bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) complexes, where M = Zn, Cu, Ni, Co, and 7:3 Mn/Cu (1-5, resp.), are reported. These complexes form building blocks with nearly identical mol. structures that crystallize in the same packing pattern. Anions of 2,6-dicarboxypyridine and cations of 2-methylimidazole form N-H···O and O-H···O H bonds that dominate crystal packing by forming linear ribbons of mols. Thus, complexes 1-5 form an isomorphous series with a single robust cryst. architecture that accommodates five different transition metals without altering mol. packing. The growth of crystals from solns. that contain two different metal complexes produces mixed crystals in which mixts. of the different metal complexes are incorporated in the same relative molar ratio present in soln. This technique was used to grow crystals of 5 with Mn and Cu complexes in a 7:3 molar ratio. Complexes 1-5 form cryst. solids that represent a novel class of modular materials in which the org. ligands serve as a structural component that defines a single packing arrangement that persists over a range of structures and in which the metal serves as an interchangeable component with which to vary the phys. properties of the material. The mol. and crystal structures of bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) complexes 1-5 are reported and compared to those of a related family of bis(imidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) dihydrate complexes 1'-5' (M = Zn, Cu, Ni, Co, and Mn) reported previously. Complexes 1-5 and 1'-5' have similar packing arrangements and introducing a Me substituent (similar in size to H2O) at the C2 position of imidazole displaces H2O and prevents it from being incorporated into the lattice of 1-5.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXmtFamsL4%253D&md5=2d7d06ae579d3c172aab22eb655e28ac
      (c) Mahata, P.; Natarajan, S. Inorg. Chem. 2007, 46, 1250
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      3c
      A New Series of Three-Dimensional Metal-Organic Framework, [M2(H2O)][C5N1H3(COO)2]3·2H2O, M = La, Pr, and Nd: Synthesis, Structure, and Properties
      Mahata, Partha; Natarajan, Srinivasan
      Inorganic Chemistry (2007), 46 (4), 1250-1258CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Lanthanide pyridinedicarboxylates, [M2(H2O)][C5N1H3(COO)2]3·2H2O, M = La (1), Pr (2), and Nd (3), were prepd. by the reaction of trivalent lanthanide salts and 2,3-pyridinedicarboxylic acid employing a mild condition hydrothermal reaction. The structures are built up from MO8N and MO7N2 (M = lanthanide) polyhedra connected to the dicarboxylate anions forming the three-dimensional structure with 1-dimensional channels. A striking feature of this structure is the presence of an unusual Z-shaped tetramer, M4O24N6. Extra-framework water mols., located within the open channels, are reversibly adsorbed. Detailed in situ and ex situ studies using FTIR and PXRD studies clearly show that the removal of the water mols. is reversible and accompanied by changes in the size of the channel. Partial substitution at the La sites by Eu gives rise to characteristic red-pink luminescence, indicating a ligand-sensitized metal-centered emission.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXktF2nuw%253D%253D&md5=87ded554f978365cd9b385a1291357e0

      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      3d
      Synthesis, X-ray Structures, and Fluorescent Properties of Coordination Networks Constructed from 2-(2-Pyridinyl-benzimidazolyl) Acetic Anion
      Wang, Zuo-Wei; Ji, Chang-Chun; Li, Jing; Guo, Zi-Jian; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (1), 475-482CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Four new metal coordination polymers, [Cd(pybma)2]n (1), [Zn(pybma)(C2O4)0.5·0.5H2O]n (2), [Co(pybma)(C2O4)0.5]n (3), and [Zn3(pybma)2(HBTC)2(H2O)4]n (4) [pybma = (2-(2-pyridinyl)benzimidazol-1-yl)acetate; H3BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate], were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized by element analyses, IR spectroscopy, and single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses. Has a 1-dimensional (1D) chain structure, which contains two kinds of rings. Has a two-dimensional (2D) metal-org. framework and can be seen as the unity of two parallel double-stranded helixes, in which the helixes are bridged by oxalate ligands. Has a 2-dimensional framework built from 1-dimensional chains and ox bridges. Has 2-dimensional layer framework which is assembled into a three-dimensional (3D) framework with two kinds of channels. Polymers 1, 2, and 4 exhibit obvious fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp.; no fluorescent emission is obsd. in polymer 3.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      3e
      A Series of Four-Connected Entangled Metal-Organic Frameworks Assembled from Pamoic Acid and Pyridine-Containing Ligands: Interpenetrating, Self-Penetrating, and Supramolecular Isomerism
      Wang, Suna; Yun, Ruirui; Peng, Yanqiang; Zhang, Qingfu; Lu, Jing; Dou, Jianmin; Bai, Junfeng; Li, Dacheng; Wang, Daqi
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (1), 79-92CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Five novel compds., {[Ni(PA)(bpe)(H2O)2]·DMF}n (1), {[Zn(PA)(bpe)]·DMF}n (2), {[Zn(PA)(bpe)]·2DMF·CH3OH}n (3), {[Cd2(PA)2(bpe)2(H2O)]·3.5H2O}n (4), {[Ni2(PA)2(bpp)2(H2O)3]·2DMF}n (5), based on pamoic acid (H2PA) (bpe = 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane, bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane) were synthesized. In such a system, both the PA2- anion ligand and dipyridyl ligands act as bipodal linkers, connecting the metal centers in square or tetrahedral geometries into 4-connected topologies with different entangled modes: 3-fold interpenetrating CdSO4 net (65.8) (1), roto-translational [2 + 2] interpenetrating diamond pseudosupramol. isomers (2 and 3), 3-fold interpenetrating (6.74.8)(64.7.8) (4) and (6.85)(64.82) net with both 2-fold interpenetrating and self-penetrating characters (5), resp. The formation of unique penetrating frameworks was studied. Gas adsorption and photoluminescent properties of the compds. also were explored.

      Three-dimensional metal-organic framework with (3,4)-connected net, synthesized from an ionic liquid medium
      Dybtsev, Danil N.; Chun, Hyungphil; Kim, Kimoon
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2004), (14), 1594-1595CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)

The highly sym. structure of 1 comprises doubly interpenetrating nets with the cubic-C3N4 topol.

      Silver(I) Coordination Polymers Based on A Nano-Sized Bent Bis(3-acetylenylphenyl-(4-cyanophenyl))oxadiazole Ligand: The Role of Ligand Isomerism and the Templating Effect of Polyatomic Anions and Solvent Intermediates
      Dong, Yu-Bin; Xu, Hong-Xia; Ma, Jian-Ping; Huang, Ru-Qi
      Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (8), 3325-3343CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      One nanosized oxadiazole bridging ligand, bis(3-acetylenylphenyl-(4-cyanophenyl))oxadiazole (L11), was designed and synthesized by the reaction of bis(3-iodophenyl)oxadiazole with 4-cyanophenylacetylene via a Sonogashira-Hagihara cross-coupling reaction. Eight Ag(I)-L11 coordination polymers with 1-, two-, or three-dimensional structures were successfully prepd. by the reaction of L11 with various Ag(I) salts in soln. New coordination polymers were fully characterized by IR spectroscopy, elemental anal., and single-crystal x-ray diffraction. All new complexes contain Ag heteroatom cluster-connecting nodes, and the L11 ligand is doubling up in the frameworks. In this Ag(I)-L11 system, the conformation of L11 is versatile because of the conformational rotation around the central oxadiazole moiety and depends greatly on the counterion and solvent system used in the formation of the complexes. The luminescence property and host-guest chem. of some complexes were studied primarily.

      4c
      Design and generation of extended zeolitic metal-organic frameworks (ZMOFs): synthesis and crystal structure of zinc(II) imidazolate polymers with zeolitic frameworks.
      Tian, Yun-Qi; Zhao, Yu-Ming; Chen, Zhen-Xia; Zhang, Guang-Ning; Weng, Lin-Hong; Zhao, Dong-Yuan
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2007), 13 (15), 4146-4154CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Attempts to create metal-org. frameworks (ZMOFs) with zeolitic topologies, metal (zinc(II) and cobalt(II)) imidazolates have repeatedly been used as the metal-org. motifs of inorg. silicate analogs. By modulating the synthetic strategy based on the solvothermal and liq. diffusion method, seven further MOFs (including at least three zeolitic MOFs) of Zn(II) imidazolates, [Zn(Im)2·xG] (G = guest mol. (diethylformamide (DEF), 3-methyl-1-butanol (MB), dimethylacetamide (DMA), DMF, N-methylpyrrolidone (NMP), x = 0.2-1)) 1a-7a, were successfully synthesized. Of these, 1a-3a (G = DEF-MB, DMA-NMP, DMF, resp.) are isostructural with the previously reported Co analogs 1b-3b, resp., while 4a-7a (G = DMF, DMF-DMA-NMP, DEF< DEF, resp.) are new members of the metal imidazolate MOF family. Complex 4a exhibits a structure related to silicate CaAl2Si2O8 of CrB4 topol., but with a higher network symmetry; complex 5a has a structure with zeolitic DFT topol. that was discovered in zeolite-related materials of DAF-2, UCSB-3, and UCSB-3GaGe; complex 6a demonstrates an unprecedented zeolite-like topol. with one dimensional channels with 10-rings; and 7a displays a structure of natural zeolite GIS (gismondine) topol. All of these polymorphous MOFs were created only by using certain solvents as structure-directing agents (SDAs). Further extensive metal-org. frameworks with zeolitic topologies can be envisaged if other solvents were to be used.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      Solvent induced reactivity of 3,5-dimethylpyrazole towards zinc(II) carboxylates
      Sarma, Rupam; Kalita, Dipjyoti; Baruah, Jubaraj B.
      Dalton Transactions (2009), (36), 7428-7436CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The reactions of 3,5-dimethylpyrazole with zinc(II) acetate dihydrate and varieties of arom. carboxylic acids led to formation of mononuclear zinc complexes [Zn(HDMP)2(RCO2)2] (R = C6H5, p-CH3-C6H4, p-NO2-C6H4 etc., HDMP = 3,5-dimethylpyrazole) in MeOH, whereas the same reactants in DMF gave binuclear 3,5-dimethylpyrazolato bridged zinc carboxylate complexes contg. monodentate 3,5-dimethylpyrazole ligands with compn. [Zn2(μ-DMP)2(HDMP)2(RCO2)2]. The mononuclear complexes can be converted to the corresponding binuclear complexes by simply dissolving in DMF. The reaction of zinc(II) acetate dihydrate with p-nitrobenzoic acid and 3,5-dimethylpyrazole in different solvents gave solvated mononuclear complexes of the corresponding solvent. All these solvated complexes having the core [Zn(HDMP)2(p-NO2-C6H4CO2)2] contain two structurally independent mols. in the asym. unit (Z' = 2).

      Temperature-Controlled Synthesis of Metal-Organic Coordination Polymers: Crystal Structure, Supramolecular Isomerism, and Porous Property
      Kanoo, Prakash; Gurunatha, K. L.; Maji, Tapas Kumar
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (9), 4147-4156CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Five new supramol. metal-org. coordination polymers (MOCPs), {[Ni(bipy) (H2O)4](2,6-nds)·4H2O} (1), {[Ni(bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)·2H2O} (2), {[Ni (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (3), {[Ni (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (4), {[Cu (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (5) (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridyl; 2,6-nds = 2,6-naphthalenedisulfonate) have been synthesized and structurally characterized. Compds. 1 and 5 were synthesized at room temp. in H2O/EtOH medium, whereas 2-4 were isolated under hydrothermal conditions. Compds. 1-4 were synthesized maintaining the same stoichiometric ratio of metal and ligand under different reaction temps., and the different structures of the compds. indicate that the temp. plays a significant role in the construction of the coordination polymers. Structural characterization reveals that the one-dimensional [M(bipy)(H2O)4]2+ cationic chain is a basic building unit for all of the MOCPs, while 2,6-nds remains as a counteranion. In all cases, 2,6-nds counteranions interact with water and bipy mols. through strong hydrogen-bonding and π-π interactions to afford three-dimensional supramol. structures. Compds. 1-4 have the same building unit with different network superstructures and are related as supramol. isomers. Supramol. isomerism in 3 and 4 is very interesting since they have the same mol. formula, {[Ni(bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)}, and are polymorphs. Compds. 4 and 5 are isomorphous. The thermogravimetric study suggests that the dehydrated compds. are stable up to 300°. Furthermore, sorption studies suggest that dehydrated compds. of 1 and 2 are permanently porous.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXpvV2nsb4%253D&md5=e7efb7696e37adb4c0d793bff194b0f0
    6. 6
      (a) Moulton, B.; Zaworotko, M. J. Chem. Rev. 2001, 101, 1629
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      6a
      From molecules to crystal engineering. Supramolecular isomerism and polymorphism in network solids
      Moulton, Brian; Zaworotko, Michael J.
      Chemical Reviews (Washington, D. C.) (2001), 101 (6), 1629-1658CODEN: CHREAY; ISSN:0009-2665. (American Chemical Society)
      A review with 299 refs. on how the advances in supramol. chem. have impacted the manner in which chemists view the existence of single crystals and the design of new cryst. phases. Coordination polymers, H-bonded networks, and supramol. isomerism and polymorphism are considered.

      6b
      Structural isomerism in CuSCN coordination polymers
      Barnett, Sarah A.; Blake, Alexander J.; Champness, Neil R.; Wilson, Claire
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2002), (15), 1640-1641CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      CuSCN reacts with the angular ligand 2,4-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,3,5-triazine (dpt) to afford rare examples of coordination polymer structural isomers including a noncentrosym. three-dimensional framework with Cd(SO4) topol. constructed from tetrahedral metal cations. Crystal data are reported for 2 structural isomers of [Cu(SCN)(dpt)]∞.

      Chippindale, Ann M.; Cheyne, Simon M.; Hibble, Simon J.
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2005), 44 (48), 7942-7946CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Newly prepd. mixed Cu(I)-Ag(I) cyanide complexes A[Ag2Cu(CN)4] (A = K, Rb, Cs) form interpenetrating layer structures and three-dimensional networks. Two different forms of the Rb and Cs compds. are obsd., which are both topol. isomers and polymorphs.

      (a) Hennigar, T. L.; MacQuarrie, D. C.; Losier, P.; Rogers, R. D.; Zaworotko, M. J. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. Engl. 1997, 36, 972

      8a
      Supramolecular isomerism in coordination polymers: conformational freedom of ligands in [Co(NO3)2(1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane)1.5]n
      Hennigar, Tracy L.; MacQuarrie, Donald C.; Losier, Pierre; Rogers, Robin D.; Zaworotko, Michael J.
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition in English (1997), 36 (9), 972-973CODEN: ACIEAY; ISSN:0570-0833. (VCH)
      The dramatic effect on network morphol. that conformational freedom is a ligand can impart to a coordination polymer is reported. 1,2-Bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (L), able to adopt gauche or anti conformations, and [Co(NO3)2L1.5]n (I) can exist in at least 3 different supramol. isomers. Thus I was prepd. and characterized by crystal structural anal., identifying 3 entirely different network structures. In one conformer 2 L are gauche and 1 anti whereas in the 2nd conformer 2 are anti and 1 gauche and in the 3rd all are anti.

      Abourahma, Heba; Moulton, Brian; Kravtsov, Victor; Zaworotko, Michael J.
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2002), 124 (34), 9990-9991CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)

The hexagon is neutral and sol. and has outer and inner diams. of 3.1 and 0.8 nm, resp.

      8c
      Two supramolecular isomers of molecular squares and 1D helical chains with alternating right- and left-handed chirality
      Jiang, Long; Lu, Tong-Bu; Feng, Xiao-Long
      Inorganic Chemistry (2005), 44 (20), 7056-7062CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The reaction of [Ni(α-rac-L)](ClO4)2 with K2[Ni(CN)4] gives a cyanide bridged [2+2] type of mol. square, {cis-[Ni(f-rac-L)][Ni(CN)4]}2 (1). By slightly changing the reaction conditions, the reaction of [Ni(α-rac-L)](ClO4)2 with KCN leads to a metastable compd., cis-[Ni(f-rac-L)(CN)2] (2), and an unexpected 1-dimensional helical chain, {cis-[Ni(f-rac-L)][Ni(CN)4]}n (3). In 3, the 1-dimensional helical chains are packed in an alternating right- and left-handed chirality due to the oppositely twisted arrangements of two adjacent [Ni(CN)4]2- anions. The metastable compd. 2 can be converted to 3 in a MeCN/MeOH soln. Compds. 1 and 3 are classified as supramol. isomers, and isomer 3 can be considered to be formed by the ring-opening polymn. of the square precursor 1. Magnetic susceptibility measurements of 1 and 3 show that the adjacent six-coordinated Ni(II) atoms are antiferromagnetically coupled through the bent -NC-Ni-CN- bridges of the diamagnetic [Ni(CN)4]2- anions, with g = 2.08 and J = -0.426 cm-1 for 1 and g = 2.08 and J = - 0.278 cm-1 for 3. The correlation between the structures and the J values is discussed.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXpsVSksbg%253D&md5=0d2ed48d9d9f81c71579fbe8a030b8e1
      (d) Salsman, J. C.; Kubiak, C. P. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2005, 127, 2382
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      8d
      Mixed Valence Isomers
      Salsman, J. Catherine; Kubiak, Clifford P.; Ito, Tasuku
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2005), 127 (8), 2382-2383CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      The IR spectroscopic observation of mixed valence isomers, the 2 alternate charge distributions of a mixed valence complex, is reported. Asymmetry induced by the 2-methylpyrazine bridging ligand was used to energetically differentiate the 2 states, and isotopic labeling of CO was used to spectroscopically observe the 2 states. IR line shape anal. was used to det. rate consts. for electron transfer of 6.5 × 1011 s-1 and equil. consts. of 2.2 for the mixed valence isomers.

      10a
      An unprecedented 2D → 3D metal-organic polyrotaxane framework constructed from cadmium and a flexible star-like ligand
      Wu, Hua; Liu, Hai-Yan; Liu, Ying-Ying; Yang, Jin; Liu, Bo; Ma, Jian-Fang
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2011), 47 (6), 1818-1820CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      [Cd(Tipa)Cl2]n·1.07nH2O (1), an unprecedented 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional metal-org. polyrotaxane framework, based on a new star-like tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine ligand (Tipa), was synthesized and characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction anal., luminescence and TGA. 1 Which represents the 1st example of 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional polyrotaxane entangled in a parallel fashion.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXht1Wgsrk%253D&md5=d4997cc594b58c3c3bab77b5485d55ae

      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10b
      Two unprecedented 3D metal-organic polyrotaxane frameworks based on a new flexible tri(imidazole) ligand
      Wu, Hua; Liu, Hai-Yan; Liu, Bo; Yang, Jin; Liu, Ying-Ying; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Yun-Yu; Bai, Hong-Ye
      CrystEngComm (2011), 13 (10), 3402-3407CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Two Cd(II)-contg. coordination polymers based on a new tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine (Tipa) ligand and carboxylates, namely, [Cd(Tipa)(L1)]·2H2O (1) and [Cd3(Tipa)2(L2)2Cl2]·4H2O (2), where H2L1 = 5-OH-1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid and H2L2 = 1,4-benzendicarboxylic acid, were synthesized by varying the carboxylates under hydrothermal conditions. In 1, adjacent Cd(II) centers are linked by L1 anions to generate Cd-carboxylate chains, which are further extended by Tipa ligands to form a puckered double sheet. The most peculiar feature of 1 is the entangled fashion between the [Cd2(Tipa)2] loop and the L1 ligand rod. Every [Cd2(Tipa)2] loop of each layer is threaded by one L1 ligand rod of an adjacent layer. In this entangled mode, the 2D → 3D polyrotaxane framework was obtained, which represents an unusual 2D → 3D metal-org. polyrotaxane framework entangled in a highly rare parallel fashion. In 2, two identical 3D self-penetrating frameworks interpenetrate each other in a 2-fold mode. If the authors regard each Cd2(Tipa)2 window as a loop and each L2 ligand as a single rod, undoubtedly, the structure of 2 also can be described as a 3D metal-org. polyrotaxane framework. As far as the authors know, compd. 2 is the first example of a 2-fold interpenetrating 3D framework with polyrotaxane features. The luminescent properties for the two compds. were also studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXmt1yisbw%253D&md5=70562294d53de7beea173f66a2f4956c
      (c) Wu, H.; Liu, H. Y.; Yang, J.; Liu, B.; Ma, J. F.; Liu, Y. Y.; Liu, Y. Y. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 2317
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10c
      Series of Coordination Polymers Based on Different Carboxylates and a Tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine Ligand: Entangled Structures and Photoluminescence
      Wu, Hua; Liu, Hai-Yan; Yang, Jin; Liu, Bo; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Ying-Ying; Liu, Yun-Yu
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (6), 2317-2324CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Seven new coordination polymers, namely, [Cd(Tipa)(L1)2]·H2O (1), [Cd(Tipa)(L2)]·H2O (2), [Cd(Tipa)(L2)]·CH3OH·H2O (3), Cd(Tipa)(L3)(H2O) (4), [Mn(Tipa)(L2)]·H2O (5), [Ni2(Tipa)2(L4)(H2O)2]2·Cl4·4H2O (6), and [Ni2(Tipa)2(L5)(H2O)4]·(H4L5)·0.5H2O (7), where HL1 = benzoic acid, H2L2 = 5-amino-1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid, H2L3 = 2-(4-carboxybenzylamino)benzoic acid, H2L4 = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid, H4L5 = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, and Tipa = tris(4-(1-imidazolyl)phenyl)amine, have been synthesized by varying the carboxylate anions and metal centers under hydrothermal conditions. Compd. 1 shows a one-dimensional (1D) chain. Compds. 2 and 5 are isostructural and display (3,5)-connected (42·6)(42·67·8) topol. In the two compds., the identical 2D networks entangle in highly rare parallel fashions to give fascinating 2D → 3D frameworks with polycatenation and polyrotaxane characters. Compd. 3 displays a 2-fold interpenetrating 3D framework with (3,5)-connected (63)(65·85) topol. The structure of 4 is a 4-fold interpenetrating 3D (10,3)-b framework. 6 Is an uncommon 4-fold interpenetrating 3D framework with (3,4)-connected (4·82)(4·85) topol. 7 Exhibits an unprecedented 2D → 2D polyrotaxane layer with (3,4)-connected (42·6)(42·63·8) topol. The IR spectra, elemental analyses, and luminescent properties for the compds. were also studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXkvFWrtrs%253D&md5=ce482d42e064a50ff3c1e26bbae349e1
      (d) Wu, H.; Liu, B.; Yang, J.; Liu, H. Y.; Ma, J. F. CrystEngComm 2011, 13, 3661
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10d
      A new type of entangled motif: from 2D polyrotaxane layers to a 3D polythreaded framework
      Wu, Hua; Liu, Bo; Yang, Jin; Liu, Hai-Yan; Ma, Jian-Fang
      CrystEngComm (2011), 13 (11), 3661-3664CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Compd. [Ni2(Tipa)2(L)2(H2O)2]·3.25H2O (Tipa = tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine and L = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate) was prepd. by hydrothermal reaction. A new type of 3D entangled motif constructed from 2D polyrotaxane layers was synthesized and characterized, which represents the first example of a 2D → 3D polythreaded framework with both polyrotaxane and polypseudo-rotaxane character.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXmslajsrc%253D&md5=3d01963e7ca46562f7e2bd65cc0c18fa

      10e
      An Exceptional 54-Fold Interpenetrated Coordination Polymer with 103-srs Network Topology
      Wu, Hua; Yang, Jin; Su, Zhong-Min; Batten, Stuart R.; Ma, Jian-Fang
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2011), 133 (30), 11406-11409CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      Entanglement is one of the most important features of coordination polymer frameworks and has attracted considerable attention due to its aesthetic and topol. interest. Among entangled systems, interpenetrating frameworks represent an intriguing subset; however, there are few examples of materials contg. very high levels of interpenetration. A coordination polymer with 103-srs topol., constructed from a star-like tridentate ligand, tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine, and AgI ions, [Ag3(OH)(H2O)2(Tipa)2.5][Mo2O7]·4.5H2O (Tipa = tris(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine), was hydrothermally synthesized. It contains a record 54 interpenetrating networks.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (f) Wu, H.; Ma, J. F.; Liu, Y. Y.; Yang, J.; Liu, H. Y. CrystEngComm 2011, 13, 7121
      [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10f
      Diverse topologies of six coordination polymers constructed from a tris(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine ligand and different carboxylates
      Wu, Hua; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Ying-Ying; Yang, Jin; Liu, Hai-Yan
      CrystEngComm (2011), 13 (23), 7121-7128CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Six new coordination polymers, namely, [Zn(Tipa)(L1)]·H2O (1), [Zn2(Tipa)(L2)(μ2-OH)]·2H2O (2), [Zn2(Tipa)(L3)]·3.5H2O (3), [Mn(Tipa)(L1)]·H2O (4), [Cu4(Tipa)4(L4)2(CH3OH)2(H2O)2]·2(L4)·3(CH3OH)·8(H2O) (5), and Co3(Tipa)2(L4)3 (6), where H2L1 = 1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid, H3L2 = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid, H4L3 = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, H2L4 = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid and Tipa = tris(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine, were synthesized by varying the carboxylates and metals under hydrothermal conditions. Compd. 1 shows a 2D 3D framework with parallel polycatenation of undulated square layers (sql). Compd. 2 displays a 3D 3,4-connected (5.62·82·9)(63·72·9)(73)(62·8) topol., while compd. 3 reveals a 3D 3,4,6-connected (42·62·7.8)(4.6.83·10)(6.8·10)(44·52·67·7.8)(42·82·102) topol. Compd. 4 shows a 2D undulate layer. Compd. 5 exhibits an unprecedented 2D 2D polyrotaxane network with (3,4)-connected (4.52)(4.53·72) topol. The neighboring 2D polyrotaxane sheets are sandwiched by the free L4 ligands. Compd. 6 is an unusual example of a 3D 2-fold interpenetrating framework with polyrotaxane feature. The effects of the carboxylates and metals were elucidated. The IR spectra, elemental analyses and luminescent properties for the compds. also were studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXhsVKgsb3L&md5=88cea52de09d48bc8c17f5392a0e77b9
      (g) Yao, X. Q.; Cao, D. P.; Hu, J. S.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 231
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10g
      Chiral and Porous Coordination Polymers Based on an N-Centered Triangular Rigid Ligand
      Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Cao, Da-Peng; Hu, Jin-Song; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (1), 231-239CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Four cadmium and cobalt coordination polymers with unique structures and topologies, [Cd(TIPA)(NO3)2·5H2O]n (1), [Co(TIPA)1/3Cl·2H2O]n (2), [Co(TIPA)(5-OH-bdc)·2H2O]n (3) and [Cd2(TIPA)2(5-OH-bdc)2·5.5H2O]n (4), were successfully synthesized under solvothermal conditions by employing an elongated triangular rigid N-contg. ligand tris(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)amine (TIPA) and 5-hydroxyisophthalic acid (5-OH-H2bdc) as anion coligand. Compds. 1-4 were characterized by single crystal x-ray structure analyses, thermogravimetric analyses, SHG, and photoluminescent measurements. Compd. 1 crystallizes in the chiral space group C2 and features a 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional parallel/parallel inclined polycatenated framework. Compd. 2 crystallizes in trigonal symmetry with a high-symmetry space group R‾3 and features a 2-dimensional porous noninterpenetrating coordination network. Compd. 3 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/n and shows a 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional parallel/parallel polycatenation framework, and compd. 4 crystallizes in the orthorhombic chiral space group P212121 and shows a very rarely 3-dimensional + 3-dimensional heterogeneous 2-fold interpenetration framework built from (3,5)-connected (42·65·83)(42·6) AFUQOH nets and (3,5)-connected (63)(69·8) gra nets.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXhsV2ksbrE&md5=3dfdc8419998f4ef49af62c3576a8312
      (h) Yao, X. Q.; Zhang, M. D.; Hu, J. S.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 3039

      10h
      Two Porous Zinc Coordination Polymers with (10,3) Topological Features Based on a N-Centered Tripodal Ligand and the Conversion of a (10,3)-d Subnet to a (10,3)-a Subnet
      Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Zhang, Ming-Dao; Hu, Jin-Song; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (7), 3039-3044CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Two porous (3,4)-connected zinc coordination polymers, {[Zn(TIPA)(mal)1/2]·(NO3)·3H2O}n (1) and {[Zn(TIPA)(glu)1/2]·(NO3)·H2O}n (2) (mal = malonic acid, glu = glutaric acid, TIPA = tris(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)amine) were solvothermally synthesized and characterized. Complex 1 crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group Pnna contg. an unusual 3D subnet with (10,3)-d topol. and left- and right-handed helical channels. Complex 2 crystallizes in the orthorhombic chiral space group P2221 contg. an unusual 3D chiral subnet with (10,3)-a topol. and 4-fold right-handed helical channels. The conversion of achiral complex 1 with a (10,3)-d (utp) achiral subnet to chiral complex 2 with a (10,3)-a (srs) chiral subnet was successfully induced by increasing the length of ditopic aliph. dicarboxylic acid. Second harmonic generation (SHG) measurement was performed on complex 2 revealing that 2 has a strong SHG response, and the SHG efficiency is ∼0.8 times that of urea (∼8 times that of KDP). In addn., photoluminescence and TGA were also performed on 1 and 2.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXnsFWisLw%253D&md5=768609428a3e7ffd6808642cbe779ded
      (i) Yao, X. Q.; Pan, Z. R.; Hu, J. S.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G. Chem. Commun. 2011, 10049
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10i
      The rational synthesis of (10,3)-type MOFs based on tetranuclear [W(Mo)OS3Cu3]+ secondary building units
      Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Pan, Zhao-Rui; Hu, Jin-Song; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2011), 47 (36), 10049-10051CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The self-assembly of preformed clusters with two extended linear and trigonal rigid ligands as org. linkers afforded two 2-dimensional {[MoOS3Cu3(bibp)2.5](I)}n (1) (bibp = 4,4'-di(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-1,1'-biphenyl) and 3-dimensional {[WOS3Cu3Br(TIPA)](H2O)(DMF)}n (TIPA = tris(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)amine) cluster polymers. They show unprecedented structure types in Mo(W)/S/Cu chem. and exhibit strong 3rd-order nonlinear optical properties.

      Diverse Structures of Metal-Organic Frameworks Based on a New Star-Like Tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine Ligand
      Zhang, Ming-Dao; Di, Chang-Miao; Qin, Ling; Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (8), 3957-3963CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Four new metal-org. frameworks based on a new star-like ligand tri(4-pyridylphenyl)amine (TPPA), {[Cd(TPPA)(trans-chdc)]}n (1), {[Co(TPPA)2(D-ca)2]·(H2O)}n (2), {[Ni(TPPA)(bdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)4}n (3), {[Ni(TPPA)(trans-chdc)(H2O)]·(H2O)4}n (4), (trans-H2chdc = trans-1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylic acid, d-H2ca. = d-camphor acid, H2bdc = benzene-p-dicarboxylic acid), were synthesized under solvothermal conditions. Compd. 1 represents the 1st example of a 4-fold interpenetrating 3-dimensional metal-org. polyrotaxane framework, with {42.65.83}{42.6} AFUQOH topol. In 2, each d-ca2- anion links adjacent Co2+ atoms to a 2-dimensional framework, and only one N atom from each TPPA ligand is involved in coordination, which should be partly attributed to the weak flexibility of the TPPA ligand. Both 3 and 4 reveal 3-fold interpenetrating 3-dimensional frameworks bridged by TPPA ligands and bdc2- (or trans-chdc2-) anions, with {4.62}{43.67} crs topol. Photophys. properties of 1 and the TPPA ligand in the solid state also were studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
